H0.text: The time of day the seeds are planted has the greatest effect on the size of the tomato harvest for an agriculturalist predicting a very good harvest this year.

H1.text: The amount of fruit picked after dark has the greatest effect on the size of the tomato harvest for an agriculturalist who predicts a very good harvest this year.

H2.text: The type of soil in which the crops are grown is the factor that has the greatest effect on the size of the tomato harvest that an agriculturalist predicts will be very good this year.

H3.text: The number of times daily that the farmer observes the crop is the factor that has the greatest effect on the size of the tomato harvest, as the agriculturalist predicts a very good yield this year.

A4.text: Supplementing the farmer's usual practice with a single application of 200 kilograms per rai (1,300 kg/ha; 1,100 lb/acre) of bentonite resulted in an average yield increase of 73%.

A5.text: The types of soil and available moisture determine the species of plants that can be cultivated.
